tuv.seg: The roles of the Defence Forces are set out in the White Paper on Defence (pdf), published in August 2015
Leagtar amach róil Óglaigh na hÉireann sa Pháipéar Bán um Chosaint (pdf), a foilsíodh i mí Lúnasa 2015
• To provide for the military defence of the State from armed aggression
• Chun foráil do chosaint mhíleata an Stáit ó ionsaí faoi airm
• To participate in multi-national peace support, crisis management and humanitarian relief operations
• Chun bheith rannpháirteach sa tacaíocht ilnáisiúnta don tsíocháin, sa bhainistiú géarchéime agus in oibríochtaí fóirithinte daonnachtúla
• To aid the civil power – meaning in practice to assist, when requested, the Garda Síochána
• Chun cabhrú leis an gcumhacht shibhialta – a chiallaíonn sa ghnáthchleachtadh go dtugtar cúnamh don Gharda Síochána nuair a iarrtar amhlaidh
• To provide a fishery protection service
• Chun seirbhís cosanta iascaigh a sholáthar
• To carry out any other duties that may be assigned to them from time to time, for example, search and rescue, air ambulance service, providing assistance in major emergencies
• Chun cibé dualgas ar bith eile a dhéanamh agus a shanntar dóibh ó thráth go chéile, mar shampla, cuardach agus tarrtháil, seirbhís aerárthaigh othar, cúnamh a sholáthar ag mór-éigeandálaí
The Defence Forces Headquarters and the Department of Defence are located in the same building in Newbridge, Kildare
Tá Ceanncheathrú Óglaigh na hÉireann agus An Roinn Cosanta suite san fhoirgneamh céanna sa Droichead Nua, Cill Dara
The Defence Forces Chief of Staff liaises with the Minister for Defence on all defence-related matters
Bíonn idirchaidreamh idir Ceann Foirne Óglaigh na hÉireann agus an tAire Cosanta i leith gach ábhar a bhaineann leis an gcosaint
The Defence Forces consist of a Permanent Defence Force and a Reserve Defence Force
Is iad na Buan-Óglaigh agus na hÓglaigh Chúltaca na fórsaí a fhaightear in Óglaigh na hÉireann
The main role of the Reserve Defence Force is to increase the capacity of the Permanent Defence Force to carry out its roles in crisis situations
Is é príomhról na nÓglach Cúltaca ná chun cumas na mBuan-Óglach a mhéadú chun a róil a chur i gcrích i gcúinsí géarchéime
The President is the Commander and Chief of the Defence Forces
Is é an tUachtarán Ceannasaí agus Ceann Óglaigh na hÉireann
The Permanent Defence Force has an establishment of at least 9,500 personnel and consists of 3 services:
Tá líon pearsanra 9,500 duine ar a laghad ag na Buan-Óglaigh, agus is iontu a fhaightear 3 sheirbhís:
The Army consists of 2 brigades
Tá 2 bhriogáid san Arm
The 1st Brigade is responsible for military operations in the southern region of the country and has its headquarters in Collins Barracks, Cork
Is í an 1ú Briogáid a bhíonn freagrach as oibríochtaí míleata i réigiún theas na tíre, agus a ceanncheathrú aici i mBeairic Uí Choileáin, Corcaigh
The 2nd Brigade is responsible for military operations in the northern region and has its headquarters in Cathal Brugha Barracks, Dublin
Is í an 2ú Briogáid a bhíonn freagrach as oibríochtaí míleata sa réigiún thuaidh, agus a ceanncheathrú aici i mBeairic Chathail Bhrugha, Baile Átha Cliath
There is also a Defence Forces Training Centre located in the Curragh Camp, Kildare
Tá Ionad Oiliúna d’Óglaigh na hÉireann suite i gCampa an Churraigh, Cill Dara
You can find more information on the Army on the Defence Forces website
Is féidir leat teacht ar a thuilleadh eolais i leith an Airm ar láithreán gréasáin Óglaigh na hÉireann
The Air Corps is the air component of the Defence Forces and has about 750 personnel
Is é an tAerchór an chuid aerga d’Óglaigh na hÉireann, agus timpeall 750 pearsanra ann
It is based at Casement Aerodrome, Baldonnel, Dublin
Is in Aeradróm Mhic Easmainn, Baile Dhónaill, Baile Átha Cliath atá sé bunaithe
Among other roles, the Air Corp operates the Ministerial Air Transport Service which provides air transport for the President and the Government
I measc ról eile, is é an tAerchór a oibríonn an tSeirbhís Aeriompair Aireachta lena soláthraítear aeriompar don Uachtarán agus don Rialtas
You can find more information on the Air Corps on the Defence Forces website
Is féidir leat teacht ar a thuilleadh eolais i leith Aerchóir ar láithreán gréasáin Óglaigh na hÉireann
The Naval Service is based on Haulbowline Island, Cork and its maximum strength is 1,144 personnel
Is in Inis Sionnach, Corcaigh atá.an tSeirbhís Chabhlaigh bunaithe, agus is é 1,144 pearsanra an líon uasta aici
Among its other duties it provides the primary diving team in the State
I measc a dualgas eile is amhlaidh a sholáthraíonn sí an phríomhfhoireann tumadóireachta sa Stát
You can find more information on the Naval Service on the Defence Forces website
Is féidir leat teacht ar a thuilleadh eolais i leith na Seirbhíse Cabhlaigh ar láithreán gréasáin Óglaigh na hÉireann
The Reserve Defence Force is a part-time volunteer force of about 4,000 personnel
Is fórsa saorálach le pearsanra tuairim 4,000 duine ann iad na hÓglaigh Chúltaca
It consists of the First Line Reserve, the Army Reserve and the Naval Service Reserve
Is iontu a fhaightear an Cúltaca Céad Líne, Cúltaca an Airm agus Cúltaca na Seirbhíse Cabhlaigh
The First Line Reserve is comprised of former members of the Permanent Defence Force
Is iad iarbhaill na mBuan-Óglach a fhaightear sa Chúltaca Céad Líne
You can find more information on the Reserve Defence Force on the Defence Forces website
Is féidir leat teacht ar a thuilleadh eolais i leith na nÓglach Cúltaca ar láithreán gréasáin Óglaigh na hÉireann
For information on recruitment, contact the Defence Forces Recruitment Section in Defence Forces Headquarters
Le haghaidh eolais i leith na hearcaíochta, déan teagmháil le Rannóg Earcaíochta Óglaigh na hÉireann i gCeanncheathrú Óglaigh na hÉireann
